allSaves.value: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

details.flavorText:
Of all the ways to die, crucidaemons represent perhaps one of the least desirable: death by torture. The fiend's shapely body, which appears to be sculpted from iron or mithril, belies a sinister wrath and love of inflicting pain. Crucidaemons particularly enjoy inflicting pain with their curved, serrated daggers, which are attached to their bodies via a chain that pierces each wrist.

A crucidaemon's existence is dedicated to subjecting its prey to an eternity of pain and terror. Unlike other daemons, many of which are eager to feed on mortal souls as soon as they can, the crucidaemon takes much greater pleasure in prolonging the agony of its victims. Oftentimes, a crucidaemon will inflict such torment and pain upon its prey that when the end finally comes, the victim tearfully thanks the daemon for the mercy of oblivion. An encounter with a crucidaemon that does not end with its death is far from over-crucidaemons have unequaled patience for those who dare oppose them.

senses.value: darkvision, detect alignment (good only), lifesense 30 feet

description.value:
You craft a trap by binding a hostile spell into a symbol. While Casting this Spell, you also Cast a Spell of a lower spell level to store in the glyph. The stored spell must take 3 actions or fewer to cast, have a hostile effect, and target one creature or have an area. You can set a password, a trigger, or both for the glyph. Any creature that moves, opens, or touches the target container or enters the target area that doesn't speak the password or that matches the trigger activates the glyph, releasing the harmful spell within.

Once a spell is stored in the glyph, the glyph gains all the traits of that spell. If the stored spell targets one or more creatures, it targets the creature that set off the glyph. If it has an area, that area is centered on the creature that set off the glyph. Glyph of warding's duration ends when the glyph is triggered. The glyph counts as a magical trap, using your spell DC for both the Perception check to notice it and the Thievery check to disable it; both checks require the creature attempting them to be trained in order to succeed.

You can Dismiss glyph of warding. The maximum number of glyphs of warding you can have active at a time is equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

The stored spell must take 3 actions or fewer to cast, have a hostile effect, and target one creature or have an area. You can set a password, a trigger, or both for the glyph. Any creature that moves, opens, or touches the target container or enters the target area that doesn't speak the password or that matches the trigger activates the glyph, releasing the harmful spell within.

The glyph counts as a magical trap, using your spell DC for both the Perception check to notice it and the Thievery check to disable it; both checks require the creature attempting them to be trained in order to succeed.

You can Dismiss glyph of warding. The maximum number of glyphs of warding you can have active at a time is equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

The stored spell must take 3 actions or fewer to cast, have a hostile effect, and target one creature or have an area. You can set a password, a trigger, or both for the glyph. Any creature that moves, opens, or touches the target container or enters the target area that doesn't speak the password or that matches the trigger activates the glyph, releasing the harmful spell within.

Once a spell is stored in the glyph, the glyph gains all the traits of that spell. If the stored spell targets one or more creatures, it targets the creature that set off the glyph. If it has an area, that area is centered on the creature that set off the glyph. Glyph of warding's duration ends when the glyph is triggered. The glyph counts as a magical trap, using your spell DC for both the Perception check to notice it and the Thievery check to disable it; both checks require the creature attempting them to be trained in order to succeed.

You can Dismiss glyph of warding. The maximum number of glyphs of warding you can have active at a time is equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

You block the target's motor impulses before they can leave its mind, threatening to freeze the target in place. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stunned]{Stunned} 1.

Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Paralyzed]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Paralyzed]{Paralyzed} for 4 rounds. At the end of each of its turns, it can attempt a new Will save to reduce the remaining duration by 1 round, or end it entirely on a critical success.

Heightened You can target up to 10 creatures.

You snuff the life out of a creature on the brink of death. The target must attempt a Will save. If this kills it, you gain 10 temporary HP and a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Dying]{Dying} value increases by 1.

Failure The target dies.

You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 1.

Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 2.

Critical Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 3 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Fleeing]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened You can target up to five creatures.

Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Invisible]{Invisible}. This makes it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Undetected]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Hidden]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

Illusory pain wracks the target, dealing 2d4 mental damage and 1d4 persistent mental damage. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes full initial damage but no @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Damage}, and the spell ends immediately.

Failure The target takes full initial and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Damage}, and the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened} 1. If the target recovers from being @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened}, the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Damage} ends and the spell ends.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened} 2.

Heightened The damage increases by 2d4 and the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Damage} by 1d4.

You shout a command that's hard to ignore. You can command the target to approach you, run away (as if it had the fleeing condition), release what it's holding, drop @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Prone]{Prone}, or stand in place. It can't Delay or take any reactions until it has obeyed your command. The effects depend on the target's Will save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to do as you command.

Critical Failure The target must use all its actions on its next turn to obey your command.

Heightened You can target up to 10 creatures.

duration.value: until the end of the target's next turn

description.value: Crucidaemons are all but impossible to fool with traps. Whenever a crucidaemon rolls a saving throw against a trap hazard, its degree of success is one better than it rolled.
When the crucidaemon casts its innate glyph of warding spell, it can store any arcane or divine spell of an appropriate level in the glyph, even if it can't otherwise cast the spell.

The crucidaemon makes two chained dagger Strikes against a single target. These attacks count toward the crucidaemon's multiple attack penalty and its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

The crucidaemon summons a new chained dagger to replace a destroyed one. A crucidaemon's daggers can't be disarmed, and they become non-magical when severed from the daemon or upon the daemon's death.
